author: @Kartikrvs

text:
Hello there,
I am Badri and I have bought iQube S on april 2023. I would like to bring up an issue to you as I saw your reviews before actually trusting this scooter. I have a strange issue with the scooter and would like to confirm it is present in all iQube scooters or only present in mine. The issue is if i travel in eco mode for say 25kms then the scooter is fine, but in power mode if i were to use full throttle then it would run into problems. First it would show an exclamation triangle while riding and if i switch off the vehicle and turn it in it would refuse to run ( Error code 002). This happened for me 2 times one at 7200kms when vehicle was in TVS service center for 3 months and the service engineers and tvs didn't know what was the problem and i later got the scooter and they did not explain me what was the problem. Second was at 8100 kms when vehicle suddenly stopped again ( this time also it happened when i drove the vehicle in power mode) - this time the vehicle did not move and screen froze but it showed no error so again I sent it to service center and it was a problem with relay and they returned the vehicle in 4 days. Now the vehicle is fine and running good. But i am afraid of driving it in power mode with speeds above 72kmph. Can you please advice on this? Is it problem in my vehicle only or all the iQube scooters?
author: @rdbhadri1983

text: My experience - Used iqube for 2 years with 22k KMS without much of problems. After that company sent service popup to replace my working conditioned battery within warranty period anticipating future threat. My bad time started then onwards & existing batteries are faulty, charger replaced, entire wiring changed but no solution found towards late charging (6-7 hours for full charge) which is not acceptable. Company used me as guinea pig & I am suffering from last 45 days with wasting time, money & energy in resolving issues. Not proven technology at all...

text:
Been owning Iqube for 2 years now 

Performance is adequate but but but ....
Build quality is horrible 
1. The rear mud flaps are mounted to the right and left shield which is plastic. Indian roads arnt that good cuz if vibration the clamps get damaged, there's actually no fix for it, you have to replace both the shields which costs you around 9500 just to fix your mudflap ....

2. Hub motor is really week 50 kmph+ accidentally if you run over a pot hole it will bend the rims, again only fix is to replace the hub motor which is 46K ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 
You can't claim insurance because it's considered as wheel bend according to their T&C ...
